# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

You can use the built-in `lowercase` function to convert a string into lower case. `replace` can be used to replace hyphens with underscores, and `strip` to remove leading and trailing whitespaces:

Here is your solution in Julia programming language:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return lowercase(replace(replace(strip(col), " ", "_"), "-", "_"))
end

println(clean_column("My Column")) # Outputs my_column
```
This function will convert the column name into lower case, remove leading and trailing spaces, replace any spaces with underscores, and finally it replaces hyphens with underscores.
